'''Genshin Impact Creator Program "Endless Journey - Streaming Event" on Twitch''' is a [[Web Event]] in [[Version 3.1]].

==Event Timeline==
Registration Period: September 23 at 19:00:00 - September 30 at 15:00:00 (UTC+8)<br>
Streaming Period: September 28 after the version update – October 18, 23:59:59 (UTC+8)<br>
Note: Participants who successfully register before September 28 at 00:00:00 (UTC+8) will be able to start streaming after the Version 3.1 update. Participants who register after September 28 at 00:00:00 (UTC+8) will need to wait until October 1 at 00:00:00 (UTC+8) to start streaming.<br>
Reward Calculation: October 24 – November 8<br>
<nowiki>*</nowiki>Rewards will be delivered to valid participants' accounts no later than 30 business days after the reward calculation period has concluded.<br>
Email Notification: Successful participants will receive an email with event details on October 2 and an email notifying them that the event ends on October 21. Please pay attention to these messages.

(10/19 Update)<br>
Please note that the mail notification announcing the end of this event will be delayed until October 29.

==Streaming Duration Event Details==
When participants reach a certain number of stream hours during the event, they will receive the corresponding rewards.
Note: "6 hours" is defined as streaming at least 6 hours in Twitch's Genshin Impact category throughout the event.
For further clarification: Reaching 6 hours equates to Primogems ×200. Reaching 9 hours equates to Primogems ×450. Reaching 12 hours equates to Primogems ×800.
The reward is limited to 15,000 sets for 6 hours of live streaming, 12,000 sets for 9 hours of live streaming, and 10,000 copies for 12 hours of live streaming.
<nowiki>*</nowiki>If the number of rewards reaches its limit, winners will be selected based on the average number of concurrent viewers.

==Consecutive Check-Ins Event Details==
During the Live Streaming Phase, participants will gain a milestone if their stream time within an "Event Week" reaches 3 hours.<br>
Every "Event Week" starts on Wednesday at 00:00:00 (UTC+8) and ends on the following Tuesday at 23:59:59 (UTC+8). See below for details (*Times provided are UTC+8).<br>
<nowiki>*</nowiki>Week 1: September 28 after the version update - October 4 at 23:59:59<br>
<nowiki>*</nowiki>Week 2: October 5 at 00:00:00 - October 11 at 23:59:59<br>
<nowiki>*</nowiki>Week 3: October 12 at 00:00:00 - October 18 at 23:59:59<br>
Participants will obtain the milestone(s) once they meet the event requirements.<br>
Participants can obtain only one milestone during each "Event Week" and a total of three milestones during the entire event duration.<br>
The reward is limited to 15,000/12,000/10,000 sets for 1/2/3 weeks of reaching the milestones in the Consecutive Check-Ins event respectively.<br>
<nowiki>*</nowiki>If the number of rewards reaches its limit, winners will be selected based on the average number of concurrent viewers.<br>
<nowiki>*</nowiki>"Streaming Duration Event" rewards and "Consecutive Check-Ins" rewards can be obtained together with "Advanced Ranking" rewards.

==Event FAQ==
Q1: Is registration required to participate?<br>
A1: Yes. Registration is required.

Q2: What are the minimum requirements to receive rewards?<br>
A2: Register for the Version 3.1 Streamer Recruitment Event.<br>
The participant's HoYoverse account must be linked to an email for contact purposes.<br>
This event is open to Genshin Impact UID accounts registered on the following four servers: America, Europe, Asia, and (TW, HK, MO).<br>
During the event, stream in the Genshin Impact Category on Twitch for a total duration of 6 hours or more.

Q3: How can I obtain the milestones in the Consecutive Check-Ins Event?<br>
A3: You can obtain a milestone by streaming 3 or more hours within an "Event Week."<br>
Every "Event Week" starts on Wednesday at 00:00:00 (UTC+8) and ends on the following Tuesday at 23:59:59 (UTC+8). See below for details (*Times provided are UTC+8).<br>
<nowiki>*</nowiki>Week 1: September 28 after the version update - October 4 at 23:59:59<br>
<nowiki>*</nowiki>Week 2: October 5 at 00:00:00 - October 11 at 23:59:59<br>
<nowiki>*</nowiki>Week 3: October 12 at 00:00:00 - October 18 at 23:59:59<br>
Participants will obtain the milestone(s) once they meet the event requirements.<br>
Participants can obtain only one milestone during each "Event Week" and a total of three milestones during the entire event duration.

Q4: I am eligible for multiple "Aim for the Leaderboard" rewards. Does this mean I can claim all the prizes?<br>
A4: No. You can only claim the highest prize.

Q5: I only streamed 7 valid hours during the event period, am I eligible for "Advanced Ranking Rewards"?<br>
A5: No. To be eligible for "Advanced Ranking Rewards," you must have at least 12 valid stream hours during the event.

Q6: How do I link an email address with my HoYoverse account?<br>
A6: Go to https://account.hoyoverse.com and log into your HoYoverse account. Confirm and verify your email address in the "Account Security Settings" submenu.

Q7: Will multimedia files/video submissions be required after the event ends?<br>
A7: No. Multimedia files/video submissions are not required.

Q8: Can I stream immediately after registration?<br>
A8: Participants who successfully register before September 28 at 00:00:00 (UTC+8) will be able to start streaming after the Version 3.1 update. Users who register after September 28 at 00:00:00 (UTC+8) will need to wait until after October 1 at 00:00:00 (UTC+8) to start streaming.<br>
<nowiki>*</nowiki>If participants start streaming before the specified time, the stream data will not be counted.

Q9: When will Primogem rewards from the Version 3.1 Twitch Streamer Recruitment be delivered?<br>
A9: Primogem rewards will be delivered within 30 business days after the Reward Calculation period.

Q10: How can I redeem for cash rewards?<br>
A10: Participants will receive a notification email with their event rankings after the event ends. Participants can redeem for cash rewards by providing information required in the email.

Q11: Am I restricted to streaming only Genshin Impact?<br>
A11: No, there are no restrictions on posting other content. However, only streaming Genshin Impact content in the Genshin Impact category allows you to be eligible for the event participation requirements.

Q12: Is a microphone or webcam required to participate?<br>
A12: No, these are not required.

Q13: I changed my Twitch username during the event. Will this affect my eligibility?<br>
A13: No. Your eligibility will not be affected.

Q14: How will I be contacted?<br>
A14: You will be contacted via the email address indicated during your registration. We recommend that you check that your inbox allows you to receive emails from @hoyoverse to prevent messages from appearing in your junk mail.

Q15: Why haven't I received any emails related to the event?<br>
A15: (a) Please make sure your email address is linked to your HoYoverse account.<br>
(b) Make sure you have not unsubscribed from official Genshin Impact emails. If you have unsubscribed, please contact Customer<br>Service.
(c) Check that the emails have not arrived in your spam or junk mail.<br>
(d) Ensure that the email address you use is the one linked to your HoYoverse account.

Q16: Is there a quick guide to streaming on Twitch?<br>
A16: Yes. Please refer to this website: https://www.twitch.tv/creatorcamp/en/setting-up-your-stream/quick-start-guide-to-streaming-on-twitch/

Q17: How do I choose the Genshin Impact category on Twitch for my stream?<br>
A17: PC - Once logged into your account, go to the "Creator Dashboard" by clicking on your profile picture. Then select "Stream Manager." On the right, you will find the "Quick Actions" tab where you can select "Edit Stream Info." A window will open where you<br>can make the necessary changes to your stream. Select "Genshin Impact" in the "Category" section and click "Done" to save!
Link: https://dashboard.twitch.tv/stream-manager<br>
More information: https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/creator-dashboard<br>
Mobile: Through the Twitch App, select the "Stream Games" button, then search and select the Game title "Genshin Impact." Next, complete the settings for your live stream.
